sentences.english: The profit was boosted by the contribution from the newly acquired natural gas business.
sentences.chinese: 純利上升主要是受惠新收購的燃氣業務貢獻所致。

sentences.english: In other words, they are pretty much pure profit.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，這項收入中很大一部分就是純利潤。

sentences.english: From the outset, half of the bank’s net profits were claimed by the crown.
sentences.chinese: 從發行伊始，銀行一半的純利潤都要歸王室所有。

sentences.english: A dollar given away is always a dollar of profit.
sentences.chinese: 拿出一美元現金就是一美元的純利阿。

sentences.english: Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing saw its profits grow 53 per cent and break through the $1 billion mark for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 港交所純利上升53%，首度突破十億大關。

sentences.english: The accounting department told us the net profit, didn't it?
sentences.chinese: 會計部門已把純利潤告訴了我們。是嗎？

sentences.english: on Tuesday reported a sharp rise in net profit for the six months ended June 30.
sentences.chinese: 香港網公佈截至六月三十日的半年業績，純利勁升。

definition: financial year/fiscal year (e.g. from April to March, for tax purposes)
achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
